availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James D. Williams (Bracken County farmer and soldier)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Ann Martin on May 16, 1852. Father of William Williams, Amanda Williams, Nancy Williams. Private in the 54th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from September 21, 1864, to November 27, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Eastern District, p. 27.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Film # 000851644, Bracken County, May 16, 1853.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 551.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Bracken County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 448 (accessed via ancestry.com).
